title: Great Falls Park: News Releases
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases               News Releases       George Washington Memorial Parkway News Release Date: Febuarry 02, 2016 Contact: Lee Werst Phone: (703) 289-2500 Email: lee_werst@nps.gov   Great Falls Park to Test "Pay on Exit" Process McLean, Va.–On February 13th and 14th Great Falls Park will be piloting a “pay upon exit” process. This pilot is being conducted to help explore the feasibility of “pay on exit” and any repercussions it could have to the visitor experience and park operations. Often, Great Falls Park has a long entrance line. This pilot will help to inform management whether collecting fees on exit will minimize wait times for people trying to enter the park. The “pay on exit” is process used at shopping malls and other parking structures in the region. About the National Park Service. More than 20,000 National Park Service employees care for America's 407 national parks and work with communities across the nation to help preserve local history and create close-to-home recreational opportunities. Visit us at www.nps.gov, on Facebook www.facebook.com/nationalparkservice, Twitter www.twitter.com/natlparkservice, and YouTube www.youtube.com/nationalparkservice.
